page.title: 08TRAVEL BY RAIL
page.content: There are two sorts of train that go through Kelvedon station, they are diesel and electric driven engines. There are 25 passenger trains going from Kelvedon to London each weekday. At the weekend there are 37 trains . One day I did a survey to count the trains. I started at 5.30 p.m. and finished at 5.50 p.m. The results were 2 trains on each side, there were three passenger trains and one cargo train which was going to London. The station was opened in about 1835 and there are two platforms joined by a footbridge. The station is mainly used by commuters who go to work in Chelmsford and London. There is a large car park where the passengers can keep their cars for the day.
